div.p: Mevenide for Eclipse distribution is composed of five different plugins : Core, Config, Grammar, Grabber and UI. They can be found here. Plugin Features are described in this document
Mevenide for Eclipse now supports Eclipse Update feature. To learn how to install Mevenide thanks the EclipseUpdate Manager, please refer to this document.

Requirements :
Eclipse 3.0M9+
JDK 1.4+
Maven 1.0 (tested with RC3)
Older releases can still be found on Sourceforge download page.
The Maven PDE Plugin allows Maven users to generate Eclipse plugin artifacts easily and keep trace of artifact inter-dependency. To install the plugin, follow instructions on the plugin's page .

The mevenide-netbeans-grammar module helps users when writing POM files, when customizing goals in maven.xml or writing their own plugins (plugin.jelly files). For details on functionality, see the module's pages.
Previous version 0.1 works with Netbeans 3.5.1, however it's missing some features and users are encouraged to upgrade to 3.6

The Mevenide Netbeans support allows to run arbitrary goals on a project, easily mount dependencies and examine project's properties files. It works with 3.5.1 and 3.6. Is not actively developed anymore, focus goes to support the upcoming Netbeans 4.0 which has advanced project support.
The snapshot version can be downloaded here .
The Maven NBM plugin allows maven users to generate Netbeans modules from their projects. To install the plugin, follow instructions on the plugin's page .
